title: Java Strings
text: Strings are used for storing text.
A String variable contains a collection of characters surrounded by double quotes:

Example
Create a variable of type String and assign it a value:
String greeting = "Hello";

title: String Length
text: A String in Java is actually an object, which contain methods that can perform certain operations on strings. For example, the length of a string can be found with the length() method:

title: More String Methods
text: There are many string methods available, for example toUpperCase() and toLowerCase():

Example
String txt = "Hello World";
System.out.println(txt.toUpperCase());   // Outputs "HELLO WORLD"
System.out.println(txt.toLowerCase());   // Outputs "hello world"


Try it Yourself »

title: Finding a Character in a String
text:
The indexOf() method returns the index (the position) 
of the first occurrence of a specified text in a string 
(including whitespace):

Example
String txt = "Please locate where 'locate' occurs!";
System.out.println(txt.indexOf("locate")); // Outputs 7


Try it Yourself »

Java counts positions from zero.0 is the first position in a 
string, 1 is the second, 2 is the third ...
